more than 200 filmmakers came to the German capital

and brings different stories

2024 marks the third time that
France's Prime Minister's Office has hosted the Summer Olympics
in 2024.  100 years since the last one in
1924 and last month, a
city in France displayed
sculptures of athletes
assembled entirely from oranges and lemons
during a two-year festival.  On the
week of February 17, the city of Tonkin
held the 90th traditional lemon festival
called
Olympia. The organizers used about
tons of citrus trees and nearly
500,000 citrus trees to create many
historical scenes.  history as well as the creation of
swimmers, tennis,
football, and the Long Bridge along the center of
boves park. It took 3,000 hours to assemble the
huge amount of fruit. We worked very
quickly to ensure that the fruit  still
in the best condition during the
two weeks of the festival. I've wanted to come here for the
festival for at least 20 years.
This is like a dream. It's
amazing. My city used to be a lemon growing area.
first in Europe, but currently there
are only 15 locations producing
this fruit, with an annual local output of
100 to 120 tons, which is not enough to organize a
lemon festival, so a large part of the
citrus imported from Spain creates  producing
works in this year's lemon festival, which
is expected to welcome about 200,000
visitors within the framework of the Columbia BF event.
Argentinian artist Kim, est vanilla music researcher, had a
special performance with the conclusion  Combining the
sounds of birds in nature with
musical instruments, the audience of
this special sound show all wore
wireless headphones. Immerse yourself in the
scenic space created from the sounds of birds
and noises.
According to researchers, indigenous people of
South America have learned
from bird sounds for thousands of years to compose music,
especially in the Flute village to reproduce bird sounds.
In the southern part of the Andes, including
northern Peru, all of Ecuador and southern Colombia,
pre-Columbian indigenous cultures
invented hundreds of styles of
flutes based on the chirping of birds, which listeners could
feel through wireless headphones.  The
subtlety in the sounds emitted from
ancient musical instruments helped the audience
feel the sounds of the mountains and forests, including
animals encroaching on
